intro: Chondrophylla nutans, commonly known as the nodding chondrophylla, is a flowering plant characterized by its delicate, drooping inflorescences. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often covered in a soft, silvery down. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Chondrophylla nutans is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
